bill.title: RELATING TO CESSPOOLS.
bill.abstract: Amends the cesspool upgrade, conversion, or connection income tax credit pilot program by repealing the provision that restricts DOH from certifying more than two residential large capacity cesspools as qualified cesspools. (HB1802 CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO CANNABIS FOR MEDICAL USE.
bill.abstract: Establishes standards and criteria for reciprocity for qualifying out-of-state medical cannabis patients and caregivers including limitations, and safeguards. Authorizes extension of written certifications of a debilitating condition for up to three years for chronic conditions. Clarifies a dispensary licensee's right to retest marijuana or manufactured cannabis products for compliance with standards. Authorizes establishment of a bona fide provider-patient relationship via telehealth. Authorizes dispensing of devices that provide safe pulmonary administration of medical cannabis by dispensary licensees. Increases the allowable tetrahydrocannabinol limit for of certain manufactured cannabis products. Limits felony convictions that disqualify an individual from employment with a dispensary ...

bill.title: RELATING TO TECHNOLOGY.
bill.abstract: Merges the Hawaii Strategic Development Corporation into the Hawaii Technology Development Corporation and renames the resulting entity as the Hawaii Innovation, Technology, and Research Corporation. Appropriates funds. (CD1)

status.statusval: Vetoed on 07-10-18 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 1253).
status.standardval: Vetoed or sent back to legislature with amendments.

bill.title: RELATING TO TAXATION.
bill.abstract: Amends the taxes withheld on the amount realized by nonresidents from the disposition of Hawaii real property from 5% to 7.25%. Applies to real estate dispositions that occur on or after 9/15/2018. (CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO AFFORDABLE HOUSING.
bill.abstract: Requires the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to institute proceedings to condemn the ground lease for the Front Street Apartments affordable housing project. Appropriates general funds for the appraisal and other preparations for the condemnation; provided that the County of Maui provides matching funds. Appropriates rental housing revolving funds to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for the expedited construction of the Leialii affordable housing project. (CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO COUNTY LAND USE REQUIREMENTS.
bill.abstract: For purposes of a county with a population of 750,000 or more: for planned community associations, requires the owner of any parcel of land subdivided as a condominium property regime in agricultural or preservation lands to provide public notice of the sale no later than ninety days after the sale of the parcel; Prohibits residential use of sheds or other structures on agricultural lands unless permitted under county ordinances and rules; allows for county enforcement and fines for violations of the prohibition; and allows for an application for registration of a project in an agricultural district to include in its verified statement comments on the availability of supportive infrastructure, the potential impact on environmental resources, and other requirements of county ordinances and ...

status.statusval: Vetoed on 07-10-18 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 1256).
status.standardval: Vetoed or sent back to legislature with amendments.

bill.title: RELATING TO CESSPOOLS.
bill.abstract: Establishes a Cesspool Conversion Working Group within the Department of Health to develop a comprehensive plan for the conversion of all statewide cesspools by 2050. Requires the University of Hawaii to conduct a comprehensive statewide study of sewage contamination in nearshore marine areas. Appropriates funding to the Department of Health to conduct research or gather technical assistance and to the University of Hawaii for the study of sewage contamination in nearshore marine areas. (CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO INNOVATION BUSINESS.
bill.abstract: Establishes the research and development program in the Hawaii technology development corporation to help Hawaii-based small businesses optimize research and development performed in Hawaii. Establishes the research and development special fund. Appropriates funds for the purposes of the research and development program. (CD1)

bill.title: RELATING TO BIOFUELS.
bill.abstract: Expands the renewable fuel tax credit cap by lowering the production threshold and expanding the types of renewable fuel eligible for the credit. Applies to taxable years after 12/31/2017. (CD1)

bill.title: An Act allowing businesses to sign up for the Do Not Call list
bill.abstract: Makes technical changes in other parts of GL c.159C to effectuate this redefinition.

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/11/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act prohibiting robocalls to all mobile telephone devices
bill.abstract: Amends provisions of GL c.159C (Telephone Solicitations) to authorize the Attorney General to enforce provisions against robocalls. In particular, the AG may initiate proceedings relating to a knowing violation or threatened knowing violation, and may include an injunction, a civil penalty or $1500-$10,000 for each knowing violation and additional relief in a court of competent jurisdiction. The attorney general may also issue investigative demands and subpoenas, administer oaths and conduct hearings in the course of investigating a violation. A person who has received more than 1 unsolicited telephonic call within a 12-month period by or on behalf of the same person or entity in violation of the prohibition on robocalls may also personally bring an action to enjoin the violation, to ...

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/11/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act updating Chapter 93H data security protections to include biometric information
bill.abstract: Amends GL 93H:1 to provide a definition for biometric indicators and to further provide that the same shall be considered personal information under GL Chapter 93H (Security Breaches).

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/11/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act requiring certain electronic toll collection fee notifications by the Massachusetts Department of Transportation
bill.abstract: ...Lane electronic tolling system. The Governor claims that the existing $100 threshold enacted by the legislature would be cost-prohibitive and violate the contract with the 3rd party vendor administering the system.

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/11/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

bill.title: An Act relative to a report on additional tax reporting requirements
bill.abstract: Department of Revenue by a year.Section 125 requires the Commissioner of Revenue to report on how he has used the authority granted in the budget to depart from federal requirements for 1099-K reporting (used to report income received from income received from electronic payments such as credit cards, debit cards, PayPal, and other third party payers). Currently, 1099-K reporting is carried out during the first two months of a calendar year, and the affected taxpayers may file the affected returns and pay their taxes as late as October of that calendar year. According to the Governor, a report as of March 15 of that calendar year will not be able to provide meaningful fiscal information. A reporting date of March 15, 2019 will allow for the preparation of a meaningful evaluation of the ...

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/11/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

sponsor.name: Joint Committee on Telecommunications, Utilities & Energy

bill.title: An Act relative to hydro
bill.abstract: Amends GL 25A:11F relating to the renewable energy portfolio standard for retail electricity suppliers; defines relicensed hydroelectric facilities that receive a new license after January 1, 2018 under the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission Rules, as Class I renewable energy generating sources; requires relicensed hydroelectric facilities seeking to operate as a Class I renewable energy generating source to provide formal notice to the department of energy resources. (New draft of HB2697. The new draft replaces the prior text pertaining to net metering tariffs for small hydroelectric power net metering facilities, with new language relating to classification of relicensed hydroelectric facilities as Class I renewable energy generating sources.)

status.statusval: House Session HS - 07/11/2018 11:00 AM House Chamber

sponsor.name: Joint Committee on Mental Health & Substance Abuse

bill.title: An Act for prevention and access to appropriate care and treatment of addiction
bill.abstract: The 2016 Act introduced a requirement that medical staff in an emergency department conduct a substance abuse evaluation and provide information on addiction treatment for any patient treated for an opioid overdose. This bill is intended to improve the effectiveness of these consultations by expanding the range of medical professionals authorized to perform the evaluation and by requiring that the emergency department affirmatively connect the patient with the appropriate level of care. The bill also permits medical professionals or police officers to authorize the transport of a patient to a substance use treatment facility for emergency assessment and treatment when the patient presents a risk of serious harm due to addiction and the patient will not agree to voluntary treatment. ...

status.statusval: New draft substituted - see HB4725

bill.title: An Act for prevention and access to appropriate care and treatment of addiction
bill.abstract: ...This bill is intended to improve the availability of substance use disorder treatment, by expanding the range of medical professionals authorized to perform the evaluation and by requiring that the emergency department affirmatively connect the patient with the appropriate level of care. The bill also permits medical professionals or police officers to authorize the transport of a patient to a substance use treatment facility for emergency assessment and treatment when the patient presents a risk of serious harm due to addiction and the patient will not agree to voluntary treatment. Additionally, the bill increases access to the overdose drug naloxone by guaranteeing that practitioners who prescribe and pharmacists who dispense naloxone in good faith will be protected from criminal or ...

bill.title: State financing and management; authorities; talent investment fund in the higher education loan authority act; implement. Amends secs. 2 & 4 of 1975 PA 222 (MCL 390.1152 & 390.1154) & adds sec. 8a.
bill.abstract: Michigan higher education student loan authority for the purpose of providing loans to eligible students and to parents of students; to prescribe its powers and duties; to authorize the authority to borrow money and issue bonds which are subject to or exempt from federal income taxation and to provide for the disposition of those funds; to exempt the bonds from taxation; to authorize the authority to acquire loans made to eligible students or to parents of students; and to authorize persons, corporations, and associations to make gifts to the authority,"" by amending sections 2 and 4 (MCL 390.1152 and 390.1154), section 2 as amended by 1987 PA 206 and section 4 as amended by 2007 PA 34, and by adding section 8a.

bill.title: Maternal Health Accountability Act of 2017
bill.abstract: ...The bill defines "pregnancy-associated death" as the death of a woman while pregnant or during the one-year period following the date of the end of pregnancy, irrespective of the cause of death. It defines "pregnancy-related death" as the death of a woman while pregnant or during the one-year period following the date of the end of pregnancy, irrespective of the pregnancy's duration, from any cause related to, or aggravated by, the pregnancy or its management, excluding any accidental or incidental cause. </p> <p>States shall develop procedures for mandatory reporting to their departments of health by health facilities and professionals concerning maternal deaths and for voluntary reporting of such deaths by family members.</p> <p>States shall investigate each case and ...
